performance_metrics.name: Uptime Percentage
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of time the server management system is operational and accessible. This is the most critical metric, reflecting availability and reliability.

performance_metrics.name: Response Time (Control Commands)
performance_metrics.description: Average time taken for the system to respond to commands issued from a central management console.  This directly impacts operational efficiency.

performance_metrics.name: CPU Utilization (Management Server)
performance_metrics.description: Average CPU utilization of the server managing the server fleet. High utilization indicates potential bottlenecks or inefficient management processes.

performance_metrics.name: Network Bandwidth (Management Traffic)
performance_metrics.description: Minimum bandwidth required for communication between the management server and the managed servers.  Higher demands necessitate higher bandwidth.

performance_metrics.name: Alerting Response Time
performance_metrics.description: Time taken for the system to acknowledge and respond to alerts generated by monitored servers. This is critical for rapid issue resolution.

performance_metrics.name: Log Volume (Daily)
performance_metrics.description: Amount of log data generated by the management system.  High volume can impact storage and analysis capabilities.

implementation_requirements.name: Authentication & Authorization
implementation_requirements.specification: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) with Role-Based Access Control (RBAC).  User roles must be strictly defined with limited permissions.
implementation_requirements.description: Secure access to the system is paramount. MFA combined with RBAC ensures data protection and prevents unauthorized modifications.

implementation_requirements.name: Redundancy & Failover
implementation_requirements.specification: Dual Network Interfaces, Redundant Power Supplies, and Automatic Failover to a Secondary Management Server.
implementation_requirements.description: Critical for high availability.  Automated failover mechanisms minimize downtime in case of component failure.

implementation_requirements.name: Centralized Logging
implementation_requirements.specification: Integration with a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) system like Splunk or ELK stack.
implementation_requirements.description: Centralized logging simplifies analysis, correlation, and reporting on system events.

implementation_requirements.name: Remote Access
implementation_requirements.specification: Secure Remote Access via VPN (Virtual Private Network) with 256-bit Encryption.
implementation_requirements.description: Allows administrators to manage servers remotely, but requires stringent security measures.

implementation_requirements.name: API Integration
implementation_requirements.specification: RESTful API for integration with monitoring tools, ticketing systems, and CMDBs (Configuration Management Databases).
implementation_requirements.description: Enables seamless data exchange and automation of tasks.

implementation_requirements.name: Configuration Management
implementation_requirements.specification: Automated server configuration deployment through tools like Ansible or Puppet.
implementation_requirements.description: Ensures consistency and repeatability in server configurations.

industry_standards: PCI DSS (if applicable – Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard)
operational_considerations: Regular Security Audits – Conducted at least annually.
